explanation: Funds are required to support JUONS [Joint Urgent Operational Needs Statement] CC-0428 and CC-0435 requirements approved by the Joint Rapid Acquisition Cell (JRAC) to fulfill Enterprise Movement Control System capabilities. Funds support AMR system server to provide an enterprise-level SIPRNET capability for tracking Army aviation services.

Funds are required in order to meet the Chief of Naval Operations direction to accelerate the development of the Anti-Torpedo Torpedo Defense System and provide two Surface Ship Torpedo Defense Prototype Systems for High Value Units (HVU); each prototype consisting of one Countermeasure Anti- Torpedo System and one Torpedo Warning System. Funds are required at laboratories and warfare centers to continue design and prototype efforts necessary to demonstrate the required capability. The systems are required to be accelerated due to the lack of torpedo defense on HVUs, which has been exacerbated by recent real-world events and evolving threats. The systems provide a hard-kill torpedo defense capability in advance of the initial operational capability as part of the program of record.
Funds are available because the Manned Ground Vehicle (MGV) was terminated. SAC Denies $28.5 million of this source

Funds are available because the CG(X) program has been terminated. This source has previously been approved by the Congress in both the March 2010 Prior Approval reprogramming action (FY 10-11 PA) and again on the Omnibus reprogramming action (FY 10-14 PA), but not all available funds were used as a result of a reduction in required increases. Of the original $11.4 million, $7.9 million remains available for reprogramming.
